Description: The Federal Trade Commission announced complaints and proposed court orders barring four national retailers from mislabeling and advertising rayon textiles as made of bamboo, and requiring them to pay civil penalties totaling $1.3 million.

Nordstrom Inc. agreed to pay a $60,000 civil penalty to settle allegations that it knowingly failed to report to the CPSC immediately, as required by federal law, that its children's hooded jackets and sweaters were sold with drawstrings at the hood and neck and thus posed a strangulation hazard.

Notes: Description field shows type of discrimination that EEOC had alleged.

Info Source: from a spreadsheet posted on the FAA website at https://www.faa.gov/about/office_org/headquarters_offices/ash/ash_programs/hazmat/compliance_enforcement/

Private Litigation Case Title: Maraventano v. Nordstrom, Inc et al
Notes: This case was settled along with 11-cv-2609.

Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of Orange
Notes: In 2004 Ernest Young and Nicole Savala filed class action lawsuits in Orange County Superior Court arguing that the way Nordstrom was calculating sales commissions violated the settlement in an earlier case. Nordstrom settled the actions for $8.905 million ($6.404 million in cash and $2.5 million in merchandise vouchers). A challenge to that settlement was rejected by a state appeals court in 2010 (case G042772).

Info Source: Contained in data obtained on May 23, 2018 in response to a Freedom of Information Act request.

Description: A group of major retailers and a group of jewelry manufacturers joined a settlement involving the presence of lead in costume jewelry sold to children.

Company: Nordstrom Nordstrom I, Inc. and Nordstrom Imports, Inc.
Description: Nordstrom Nordstrom I, Inc. and Nordstrom Imports, Inc. were ordered to pay $2,163,142 restitution and a $100,000 administrative penalty in an Order finding they deceptively sold securities in the state as an unregistered dealer or salesman.

Notes: Company is plan administrator. Penalty amount reported in range of $10,001 to $50,000.
